title: ğŸš€ Installation Guide - Learn Urdu Quarto Project
text:
Complete step-by-step instructions for setting up your Urdu learning platform.


Before starting, ensure you have:

Computer with Windows, Mac, or Linux
Internet connection
At least 2GB free disk space
Admin/sudo access (for installations)







Go to https://cran.r-project.org/bin/windows/base/
Click â€œDownload R-4.x.x for Windowsâ€
Run the installer
Follow default installation options
Verify: Open CMD and type R --version





Go to https://cran.r-project.org/bin/macosx/
Download R-4.x.x.pkg
Double-click to install
Verify in Terminal: R --version




sudo apt update
sudo apt install r-base
R --version





Download RStudio Desktop (Free)

Visit: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/
Click â€œDownload RStudio Desktopâ€
Choose your operating system

Install

Run the installer
Follow default options
Launch RStudio to verify






Download Quarto

Visit: https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/
Click download for your OS
Version 1.3+ required

Install

Run installer
Follow prompts
Restart RStudio after installation

Verify Installation
quarto --version
Should show version 1.3.0 or higher




Open RStudio and run:
# Essential packages
install.packages(c(
  "quarto",
  "dplyr",
  "ggplot2",
  "DT",
  "knitr",
  "kableExtra",
  "htmltools",
  "rmarkdown",
  "jsonlite"
))

# Verify installation
library(quarto)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
If you get errors:
# Try installing one at a time
install.packages("dplyr")
# Then the next one, etc.






Download all files I provided
Create folder: learn-urdu-quarto/
Organize files according to structure shown in README




git clone https://github.com/yourusername/learn-urdu-quarto.git
cd learn-urdu-quarto




Create this exact folder structure:
learn-urdu-quarto/
â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml
â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ alphabet.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ vocabulary.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ grammar.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ conversations.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ quizzes.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ writing.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ challenges.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ progress.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ study-buddy.qmd
â”œâ”€â”€ README.md
â”œâ”€â”€ data/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ vocabulary.csv
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ (other data files)
â”œâ”€â”€ audio/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ (audio files - optional)
â”œâ”€â”€ js/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ audio-player.js
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ quiz-engine.js
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ writing-practice.js
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ progress-tracker.js
â”œâ”€â”€ css/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ custom.css
â””â”€â”€ R/
    â””â”€â”€ (R scripts - optional)


Windows (PowerShell):
# Navigate to your desired location
cd C:\Users\YourName\Documents

# Create structure
mkdir learn-urdu-quarto
cd learn-urdu-quarto
mkdir data, audio, js, css, R
Mac/Linux (Terminal):
# Navigate to your desired location
cd ~/Documents

# Create structure
mkdir -p learn-urdu-quarto/{data,audio,js,css,R}
cd learn-urdu-quarto





Copy all .qmd files to project root
Copy data files to data/ folder
Copy JavaScript files to js/ folder
Copy CSS file to css/ folder



# In RStudio, check files
list.files()  # Should show .qmd files
list.files("data/")  # Should show .csv files
list.files("js/")  # Should show .js files





Open RStudio
Open Project:

File â†’ Open Project
Navigate to learn-urdu-quarto/
Select learn-urdu-quarto.Rproj (if exists)
Or: File â†’ New Project â†’ Existing Directory

Render Site:
quarto::quarto_render()
Preview Site:
quarto::quarto_preview()
Should open in browser!







Skip audio files completely
System uses browser TTS automatically
Works immediately





Visit Forvo.com
Search for Urdu words
Download pronunciations
Save to audio/ folder with exact filenames from CSV





Use Audacity (free)
Record pronunciations
Export as MP3
Match filenames in vocabulary.csv




audio/
â”œâ”€â”€ assalam.mp3
â”œâ”€â”€ shukriya.mp3
â”œâ”€â”€ haan.mp3
â”œâ”€â”€ nahi.mp3
â””â”€â”€ ...







Homepage loads
Navigation works
Tables display correctly
Urdu text shows properly (right-to-left)
Audio buttons appear (even without files)
Quizzes are interactive
Progress tracking works




Urdu text looks wrong:
# Check _quarto.yml has:
include-in-header:
  - text: |
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Noto+Nastaliq+Urdu:wght@400;700&display=swap" rel="stylesheet">
Tables donâ€™t show:
# Install missing package
install.packages("DT")
install.packages("kableExtra")
Audio doesnâ€™t work: - Normal! Just means files not added yet - Will use text-to-speech fallback







Create GitHub Account (if needed)

Go to github.com
Sign up for free

Create Repository

Click â€œNew repositoryâ€
Name: learn-urdu
Public
Initialize with README

Upload Files
# In your project folder
git init
git add .
git commit -m "Initial commit"
git remote add origin https://github.com/yourusername/learn-urdu.git
git push -u origin main
Enable GitHub Pages

Repository â†’ Settings â†’ Pages
Source: Deploy from branch
Branch: main
Folder: /docs
Save

Build and Deploy
# Render to docs folder
quarto::quarto_render()
# Push to GitHub
git add docs/
git commit -m "Deploy website"
git push
Your Site is Live!

URL: https://yourusername.github.io/learn-urdu/
Takes 2-5 minutes to go live





If you already have myaseen208.com:

Build Site
quarto::quarto_render()
Copy docs folder to your website

Rename to: learn-urdu/
Upload to: myaseen208.com/learn-urdu/

Update your main site Add link:
<a href="/learn-urdu/">Learn Urdu</a>








Edit data/vocabulary.csv
Add row: category,difficulty,urdu,roman,english,audio.mp3
Run: quarto::quarto_render()
Push to GitHub





Edit quizzes.qmd
Add questions to quizDatabase object
Render and deploy





Edit css/custom.css
Change color values
Render and deploy





Your Urdu learning platform is now live!






Check Console:
# In RStudio, check for errors
quarto::quarto_check()
Verify Packages:
# List installed packages
installed.packages()[,1]
Update Everything:
# Update R packages
update.packages(ask = FALSE)

# Update Quarto
quarto::quarto_update()
Common Fixes:
# Clear cache
quarto::quarto_render(cache_refresh = TRUE)

# Restart R Session
# Session â†’ Restart R





Check README.md for troubleshooting
Search error messages on Google
Post issue on GitHub
Email: contact@myaseen208.com





Now that your site is running:

Add Audio Files - Improve pronunciation
Create More Quizzes - Test knowledge
Add Grammar Lessons - Expand content
Integrate AI Study Buddy - Get help feature
Track User Progress - See improvements
Share with Friends - Help others learn!






# Preview site
quarto::quarto_preview()

# Render site
quarto::quarto_render()

# Check installation
quarto::quarto_check()

# Update Quarto
quarto::quarto_update()




Content: .qmd files in root
Data: data/ folder
Styling: css/custom.css
Scripts: js/ folder
Output: docs/ folder (generated)




# Delete generated files
unlink("docs", recursive = TRUE)
unlink("_site", recursive = TRUE)

# Re-render
quarto::quarto_render()

Congratulations! Youâ€™ve built a complete Urdu learning platform! ğŸ‰

Practice Recommendations

ğŸ“š Study Strategy by Level
Beginners (0-50 words): - Start with greetings and numbers - Learn 5-10 new words daily - Focus on pronunciation - Practice with flashcards
Intermediate (50-200 words): - Add new categories (family, food, body) - Learn 10-15 words daily - Create simple sentences - Practice conversations
Advanced (200+ words): - Master all categories - Learn idiomatic expressions - Focus on verbs and adjectives - Write short paragraphs
